sentences: Ma käisin Roomas viimati kolm aastat tagasi.
Rooma on üks ilusamaid linnu Euroopas.
context: The word 'rooma' is the Estonian form of 'Rome', referring to the capital city of Italy. It can be used in nominative case as shown in the examples, and would have different endings in other grammatical cases like 'Roomas' (in Rome), 'Rooma' (Rome/accusative), etc.
